description.en: Mountainous region known for ancient temples, hill tribes, cooler climate, and cultural heritage.
description.nl: Bergachtige regio bekend om oude tempels, bergstammen, koeler klimaat en cultureel erfgoed.

geography: Mountainous terrain with peaks reaching over 2000m. Dense forests, river valleys, and hill tribe villages. Borders Myanmar and Laos.
culture: Rich Lanna heritage with distinct architecture, crafts, and traditions. Home to various hill tribes including Hmong, Karen, and Akha peoples.
cuisine: Khao Soi curry noodles, Sai Oua sausage, sticky rice, northern curries. Influenced by Burmese and Lao cuisine.
transportation: Domestic flights to Chiang Mai/Chiang Rai. Buses connect cities. Songthaews and tuk-tuks locally. Motorbike rentals popular.
budgetInfo: Budget: $25-40/day. Mid-range: $40-80/day. Luxury: $80+/day. Accommodation cheaper than Bangkok.
topActivities: Temple hopping, hill tribe trekking, cooking classes, elephant sanctuaries, zip-lining, white water rafting, hot springs
hiddenGems: Pai canyon, Mae Hong Son loop, Doi Mae Salong tea plantations, Sangkhlaburi, Mon Bridge
localFestivals: Loi Krathong (November), Songkran (April), Yi Peng Lantern Festival (November), Flower Festival (February)
travelTips: Pack warm clothes for evenings. Respect hill tribe customs. Book tours through reputable operators. Learn basic Thai phrases.
whatToPack: Warm jacket, comfortable walking shoes, insect repellent, sunscreen, modest clothing for temples, rain jacket
